item.title: Ticket #3215 (Login & Update functions everything is broken) updated
item.dc:creator: Xmion
item.description:
The problem is in pluggable.php 

// Cookie safe redirect.  Works around IIS Set-Cookie bug.
// http://support.microsoft.com/kb/q176113/
if ( !function_exists('wp_redirect') ) :
function wp_redirect($location, $status = 302) {
	global $is_IIS;
	$location = preg_replace('|[^a-z0-9-~+_.?#=&;,/:%]|i', '', $location);
	$location = wp_kses_no_null($location);
	$strip = array('%0d', '%0a');
	$location = str_replace($strip, '', $location);
	if ( $is_IIS ) {
		header("Refresh: 0;url=$location");
	} else {
		status_header($status); // This causes problems on IIS
		header("Location: $location");
	}
}

item.title: Ticket #3215 (Login & Update functions everything is broken) updated
item.dc:creator: Xmion
item.description:
Keywords, Severity changed

OK i have been on every singel page now in the LATEST SVN.. on 3 servers

Every page is broken when you try to post or make a page, change team, activate plugin, make a user, change password etc etc......

And the only thing that works is the update on permalinks.

I have one site my friend has been giving away so i can use it as testing for us all till they gonna have it i guess.

Server Information: MySQL 4.0.24_Debian-10sarge2-log running on localhost ​http://www.teamharmoni.com/phpinfo.php

​http://www.teamharmoni.com/wp-login.php Login: admin Password testing

If you get a blank page! just type: ​http://www.teamharmoni.com/wp-admin/

Hope somebody have something to say about this or what the problem is :/

Following is my errors in 2 browsers:

Firefox Found 

The document has moved here.
Additionally, a 500 Internal Server Error error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.

Explorer 

The page cannot be displayed
The page you are looking for is currently unavailable. The Web site might be experiencing technical difficulties, or you may need to adjust your browser settings.

item.title: Ticket #3216 (Smilies don't work if it is the last thing in a blog post :)) created
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Smilies don't work if it is the last thing in a blog post :)

A post of only "Smilies :)" does not convert the smily

"Smilies :) :)" will convert the 1st but not the second

":)

." will also convert the smily.

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

This bug does not exist in 2.0.4 or 2.0.4+ r6640

Copying Nazgul b/c of his recent work in this area: ticket:2444 , #1279 , #3201

item.title: fix-feed-rewrite-rules.diff attached to Ticket #3214
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description: Fix wp-rewrite to handle these feeds correctly

item.title: Ticket #3214 (Permalink which starts with %category% breaks access to feeds via ...) created
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
The feed files in the root of the wordpress install do not return the correct feeds with a permalink structure like /%category%/%year%/%postname%/ as the rewrite rules match the feed filename as a category and try and return a category archive feed for a non-existant category.

I found this while fixing #3188

Patch attached to fix this issue - including a required db dumb to ensure the rewrite rules are regenerated.

item.title: Ticket #3213 (Option sub-menus disappear off the screen to the right) created
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
Under the new CSS for 2.1, submenu options disappear off to the right, with no scrollbar or anything to indicate they're there, if you have a number of them (I have 7 in addition to the core set).

The attached patch fixes the problem by applying the height of 25 pixels to the li rather than the ul.

item.title: Ticket #3212 (Inline Upload Style) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Even after [4349], some of the inline upload inputs are pretty narrow. This can be particularly frustrating when writing a long description.

Attached

  1. Widens some of the inputs and tables.
  2. Adds an easy way of grabbing the uploaded file's URL.
  3. onclick="false" on direct links to files when in inline mode so that the user never gets to a dead end in the iframe (the links are still there to be right clicked or whatever).
  4. Better defaults for the_attachment_links().
  5. Fixes nonce bug when deleting freshly uploaded file.

item.title: Ticket #3210 (Remove in 1.4) created
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
wp-settings contains the following code 

if (!strstr($_SERVER['PHP_SELF'], 'install.php')) :
    // Used to guarantee unique hash cookies
    $cookiehash = md5(get_option('siteurl')); // Remove in 1.4
	define('COOKIEHASH', $cookiehash);
endif;

As we're nearing 2.1 we should remove the code or the comment.

item.title: Ticket #3014 (why use the @?) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords, Severity changed

I disagree with just throwing the errors, because users will then blame WordPress for throwing those errors, generating just as much of a support burden.

Maybe it's an idea to include some kind of test during the initialization/install process. (Check if dir() is allowed, etc..)

item.title: Changeset [4348]: Relativize links. Props mdawaffe.
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Relativize links. Props mdawaffe.

item.title: Ticket #2039 (Wordpress fails silently when cookies are disabled) updated
item.dc:creator: sjmurdoch
item.description:
@Nazgul

For usability reasons, yes I think this should be caught programatically. Otherwise there is an extra message to read for the users who have cookies enabled. For those who do not, a static footnote could be easily missed, whereas a big error message would be clear.
